title: Is the SRS under configuration management category CC2?
description: Is the SRS under configuration management category CC2?

title: Is the SRS under configuration management category CC1?
description: Is the SRS under configuration management category CC1?

title: Does the SRS include the methods to be used for developing SW requirements?
description: Does the SRS include the methods to be used for developing SW requirements?

title: Does the SRS include the notations to be used to express requirements, such as data flow diagrams and formal specific languages?
description: Does the SRS include the notations to be used to express requirements, such as data flow diagrams and formal specific languages?

title: Do the notations used to define formal models have mathematically defined syntax and semantics, and are constraints compatible with formal methods?
description: Do the notations used to define formal models have mathematically defined syntax and semantics, and are constraints compatible with formal methods?

title: Does the SRS include constraints on the use of the tools used for requirements development?
description: Does the SRS include constraints on the use of the tools used for requirements development?

title: Does the SRS include the method to be used to provide derived requirements to the system processes?
description: Does the SRS include the method to be used to provide derived requirements to the system processes?

title: If high level requirements are expressed as a model, are these addressed in software model standards (see Software Modeling Standards (SMS) schecklist for more details)?
description: If high level requirements are expressed as a model, are these addressed in software model standards (see Software Modeling Standards (SMS) schecklist for more details)?

title: If MBD is planned, does the SRS include methods to ensure that the higher-level requirements are adequate to support implementation and verfication of the Design Model?
description: If MBD is planned, does the SRS include methods to ensure that the higher-level requirements are adequate to support implementation and verfication of the Design Model?

title: Will adherence to the SRS enable software components of a given software product or related set of products to be uniformly designed and implemented?
description: Will adherence to the SRS enable software components of a given software product or related set of products to be uniformly designed and implemented?

title: Does the SRS prevent the use of constructs or methods that produce outputs that cannot be verified or that are not compatible with safety-related requirements?
description: Does the SRS prevent the use of constructs or methods that produce outputs that cannot be verified or that are not compatible with safety-related requirements?

title: Does the SRS include considerations regarding the robustness of requirements?
description: Does the SRS include considerations regarding the robustness of requirements?
